abstract: Disney posted a quarterly profit far ahead of Wall Street targets on strong results at its theme park, media and consumer products groups, sending shares up 5 percent.
snippet: Disney posted a quarterly profit far ahead of Wall Street targets on strong results at its theme park, media and consumer products groups, sending shares up 5 percent.
lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES  The Walt Disney Company, reporting fiscal first-quarter results, sought to reassure investors that the weakening economy was not affecting television advertising sales or its robust theme park business.

headline.main: Disney Is Upbeat Despite Economy’s Troubles
headline.print_headline: Disney Presents an Upbeat Outlook Despite Economy’s Troubles

abstract: Revenue for The Walt Disney Company “rose 9 percent, to $10.45 billion, led by gains in advertising revenue at ABC and ESPN,” Brooks Barnes reports in today’s Times. In its fiscal first quarter:
lead_paragraph: Revenue for The Walt Disney Company “rose 9 percent, to $10.45 billion, led by gains in advertising revenue at ABC and ESPN,” Brooks Barnes reports in today’s Times. In its fiscal first quarter:

abstract: CNBC interviews Bob Iger, chief executive of Disney, about the company's earnings and his efforts to negotiate an end to the writers' strike.
snippet: CNBC interviews Bob Iger, chief executive of Disney, about the company's earnings and his efforts to negotiate an end to the writers' strike.
lead_paragraph: CNBC interviews Bob Iger, chief executive of Disney, about the company's earnings and his efforts to negotiate an end to the writers' strike.
